title._content: ["Mariemont," Thomas Josephus Emery house, Honeyman Hill, Middletown, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Mariemont," Thomas Josephus Emery house, Honeyman Hill, Middletown, Rhode Island. Arbor pathway] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House architecture: Richard Morris Hunt, designed 1871, altered by Thomas J. Emery circa 1901. Landscape: 19 acres by John Charles Olmsted, Henry Vincent Hubbard, James Frederick Dawson, Olmsted Brothers, 1903-1908. Gardeners: Alexander Anderson and Andrew L. Dorwood. Associated Name: Mary Hopkins (Mrs. Thomas J.) Emery. Today: House extant but gardens subdivided. On slide (handwritten): "E" and "Emery, Mrs. T. J., Newport, R.I." Also, no. "11" in upper right corner and no. "22" in circle. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16175 Call Number: LC-J717-X99- 17
